tests.name: Visual Assessment
tests.description: Evaluate color, texture, and organic matter
instructions: Spread dry soil sample on a white surface or paper
Observe the color in natural daylight
Look for organic matter (roots, leaves, dark particles)
Feel the texture when dry
Take a representative photo
photoGuidelines: Spread soil evenly on white background
Include color reference card if available

fields.label: Additional observations
fields.placeholder: Note any unusual features, impurities, or characteristics

tests.name: Ribbon Test
tests.description: Clay content assessment by forming soil ribbons
instructions: Take a handful of soil
Add water gradually and mix until it forms a putty-like consistency
Roll the moist soil into a ball about the size of a golf ball
Squeeze soil between thumb and forefinger to form a ribbon
Let the ribbon extend out until it breaks under its own weight
Measure the length of the ribbon before it breaks
photoGuidelines: Take photo of longest ribbon before it breaks
Hold ribbon horizontally with ruler visible
Clear view of ribbon length and thickness

fields.label: Ribbon length before breaking
fields.hint: Length from start of ribbon to break point

fields.label: Additional observations
fields.placeholder: Note ribbon flexibility, cracking, or other features

tests.name: Ball Drop Test
tests.description: Test moisture content and binding properties
instructions: Mix soil with water to optimal moisture (should hold shape when squeezed)
Form soil into a ball about the size of a golf ball (40-50mm diameter)
Compact the ball firmly by squeezing
Drop the ball from a height of 1 meter (3 feet) onto a hard surface
Observe how the ball behaves on impact
photoGuidelines: Take photo of the ball after it has dropped
Show the full break pattern or intact shape
Include ruler or reference object for scale
Good lighting to show cracks or breaks

fields.label: Additional observations
fields.placeholder: Note crack patterns, deformation, or other features

tests.name: Jar Test (24 Hour Setup)
tests.description: Sedimentation test to measure sand, silt, and clay ratios - Complete this test to refine your results
instructions: Collect dry soil sample and crush any large clumps
Fill a clear jar 1/3 full with soil
Add water until jar is 2/3 full
Add a pinch of salt or detergent to help separation
Screw lid on tightly and shake vigorously for 1 minute
Place jar on a flat, stable surface
Set a reminder to return in 24 hours
Let settle for 24 hours undisturbed
photoGuidelines: Take photo of settled jar after 24 hours
Ensure jar is upright and level
Include a ruler or measuring tape next to jar
Clear view of all sediment layers

fields.label: Total sediment height
fields.hint: Measure from bottom of jar to top of settled sediment

fields.label: Clay layer height (top layer)
fields.hint: Finest particles, may still be cloudy

fields.label: Additional observations
fields.placeholder: Note any unusual features, colors, or difficulties
